abstract: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday to acquire XTO Energy. By using its treasury shares to pay for XTO, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.
snippet: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday to acquire XTO Energy. By using its treasury shares to pay for XTO, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday, snapping up XTO Energy in an all-stock transaction valued at $31 billion, plus the assumption of $10 billion in debt. By paying for XTO with its treasury shares, which it has built up slowly over the last decade, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil Opens  Its Huge War Chest
